title: Play next on crave.ca fails error 202000
content:
Using the website crave.ca, the browser fails to play the next video in the series and shows the error: "This video cannot be played because of a technical error.(Error Code: 202000)"

This error happens on Firefox, but not other browsers like Chrome. It happens both on Windows 10 and Fedora Workstation 33.

Looking at the jwplayer docs, it gives a bit more info, but not much (https://developer.jwplayer.com/jwplayer/docs/jw8-player-errors-reference)

Unknown error. This is generally caused by an unknown XHR error or an exception thrown while parsing the content; for more context we recommend checking the source error.

So, it sounds like a site coding error, but it seems strange that would be the case when other browsers are working fine. Any ideas how to get this working in Firefox?
creator: nik16

title: Firefox search
content:
Hi all,

title: Many regularly visited sites and buttons not working over the past few weeks
content:
I moved from Chrome to Firefox this summer. Firefox on my MacBook Air worked fine until about three weeks ago, when many pages I regularly visited just fine previously stopped loading, loaded slowly, or loaded but many of the forms and buttons/links didn't work.

I'm running the latest version of Firefox. Before I try any of their recommended methods like refreshing, I wanted to see if this is a common thing and will hopefully be fixed in the next update, as I'd prefer not to set everything up again from scratch.

All of the pages that I've had problems with work fine in Chrome still, and I didn't make any changes to any Firefox or extension settings before this happened.

The two main extensions I use that I could see interfering with pages are uBlock Origin and HTTPS everywhere, but I didn't make changes to those and had been running them for months, since I started using Firefox again.

Thanks for reading and for any guidance that will help prevent me from effectively starting over.

title: Freaking zombie bookmarks keep re-appearing.
content: This is truly starting to tick me off. I continue to have issues with deleting bookmarks, only to have them re-appear hours or days later. Then, since FF is getting dumber and dumber, I went into the other user account on my laptop and deleted all the bookmarks from THAT instance of FF. Then, I went to FF on both my Android phones and deleted all the bookmarks from THOSE. And today, guess what, ALL THESE BOOKMARKS ARE BACK. This - combined with the brutal hack job Mozilla did to the mobile version of FF - is starting to make Chrome look like an attractive browser choice.

title: "Prompt for filename" dialog hangs
content:
I have FF 84 (64-bit) running on Windows 10 (1809, build 17763.1282)

When I try to save a file or upload a file, the dialog that prompts me for the filename and folder hangs, I have to kill FF. I am unable to upload or download files.

This started slowly over time and several FF versions. At first, the dialog was slow and took a few seconds, then it became a minute, now it is permanent, preventing me from up or downloading anything. File type doesn't matter, it is the dialog box that hangs.

When I select to download a file to a specific location, it works normally. This happens only with option enabled to "prompt for file name". So, there is a work-around for file downloads, but not for uploading files, which I frequently have to do (to our Sharepoint site).

This is happening only on my work laptop, neither on my personal laptop nor desktop. Unfortunately, IT has our systems locked up, there is very little I can do.

I did have IT uninstall and reinstall FF, but I used my old profile settings, so I it is possible that it might be related to those. However, this is also happening with Google Chrome (slow, does not hang), but not with Internet Exploder or Edge, both of which behave normally.

title: Color shift when copy/pasting image from Firefox
content:
Lately I've come to realize that when you copy/paste an image directly out of Firefox there's a distinct color shift (it's lighter and desaturated) when you paste that image into a graphics program like Photoshop. If you manually save the image and then open it in Photoshop, there is no color shift. If you copy/paste the same image from Chrome or Safari and paste it into Photoshop there is no color shift and it looks great. It would greatly improve my workflow if I could figure out how to fix this.

In the attached image you'll see the original image saved from Firefox with "save image as..." and on the right the same image copy & pasted into Photoshop. I do not think this is a color management/profile issue in Photoshop, as copying from a variety of other sources doesn't cause the shift.

title: Group file downloads from Page Info media tab not working on Mac version 84.0
content: I noticed a strange problem on my iMac after installing the latest version of Firefox 84.0. When I attempt to download multiple image files via the "Page Info" Media tab, the download appears to initiate, but then gets stuck. It doesn't even appear in the Downloads window either, but I know it's processing invisibly in the background because when I quit Firefox I get the message "you have 1 active download. do you want to quit?" I tried this on several websites just to see if maybe one website was the issue, but it happens everywhere. However, when I download one single image at a time, that file seems to download immediately without any issue, and appears in the Downloads window. I rebooted Firefox in safe mode to see if there was an add-on or extension causing the issues, but I still have the problem. I even reset my Downloads folder using the config settings. The downloads worked fine when I was using 83.0. Anyone have idea what the problem might be?

title: Saving the file associations to handlers.json no longer works
content:
I work on local web platform where I need to have quick access to several thousands of Word documents. I access these docs by clicking a link on the platform. To speed up things, I had all the file associations saved in this file:

Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\<profile_name>\handlers.json

This way, each file opens quickly, without Firefox asking me about the application I'd like to use to open it.

These associations also show up in this menu: 'OPTIONS -> GENERAL -> FILE & APLICATIONS -> Choose how Firefox handles the files you download from the web or the applications you use while browsing.'

Ever since updating Firefox to version 84.0, this no longer works, as Firefox is once again showing up a small window, with this question:

"Allow this site to open the '<file_association_name>' link?"

I believe something changed with this latest version, as I have not changed anything to my configuration.

My goal is to save these associations so that I can skip this question when opening a file. Checking the "always allow" option won't help me that much since I have thousands of Word files.

So, it used to work by saving these associations to the 'handlers.json' file, but ever since I updated to the latest version, this no longer works.

Any idea about what could be the problem?

Thank you,

Alex

title: It is time to deprecate Firefox after 16 years
content:
Hello I have been a Firefoxan since the year 2004. I really admired what Mozilla did to compete in the browser market. Recently, Firefox not longer accepted to "Submit feedback" via the browser menu. I wanted to complain about a couple of things but it took a lot of time for me to reach here. Believe me Mozilla, this is not a good time to stop listening to users and refuse to receive complains.

It is high time for me to move to another browser after 16 years.

title: Why was the shortcut for the bookmark manager changed?
content:
Hello!

After updating to the most recent version the shortcut (CTRL+SHIFT+B) for the bookmark manager has changed to CTRL+SHIFT+O . WHY?!? after years and years now that? the old one you could manage with one hand...especially annoying if you use the bookmark manager often and used to open it with one hand while not having to let go off the mouse with the other hand. and second... is there a way to customize shortcuts etc? in the old firefox there was apparently, but that is now gone?!? or is there a way with the help of about:config?

with regards

title: Facebook Container
content: I use containers including Facebook container. When I attempt to log in to a website, I get a small message box telling me I should allow Facebook tracking so Facebook can give me good services etc. I am blocked from logging in. The message box has a cancel button but this closes the box only to have it re-appear if I again attempt to type my details. The colored 'picket' fence appears on the page AND each end of the log in button.This website was not in a container however when I put it in one I still am blocked logging in. I informed the website. This morning the website asked me if I am still blocked indicating it was attempting to find a solution. I am still blocked. How to fix? I have a screen dump.
creator: towle_thomas

title: Switching Between Seperate Firefox Accounts
content: My brother and I have separate Firefox accounts. He stays with me a lot for weeks or even months at a time. He's not an avid smart phone user. He prefers a desktop PC just as I do. The big problem is we can't switch accounts. All his passwords and web sites are linked to his account, the same as mine is to mine. If I log out of my Firefox and he attempts to log into his, we get a warning that all synced items will be merged. We end up not switching. This is very frustrating for him since he doesn't remember his sign-in's. He relies on his Firefox account for that. Is there any way around this? We can do it with Google and his AOL accounts. Anybody have any ideas?
creator: pzajac

title: Open settings for gmail on firefox
content: Unable to access google settings for gmail on firefox, can right click and open in a new tab but not on firefox. Just started today, also gmail layout is different. Thanks for your help. I hope I have stated the proble clear enought.
creator: tom.n.ollie

title: Is it possible to share a FF profile on two computers?
content:
I have been using Firefox for ages now, and collected a rather large number of bookmarks (>15,000) As far as I know such a number poses some issues, for instance I tried several times to use Sync but was never able to use it.

Since I am using two different machines, I tend to save my bookmarks only on the main one. When I am working on the laptop I never save bookmarks but I message them to myself (never been able to save them on my main machine, sigh) and every once in a while I "restore" bookmarks from the backup set of the main machine on the laptop. It always takes a while and oftentimes it feels like the process hangs, but so far I managed.

Today I started wondering again if there's a less frustrating and more efficient way to handle this. The question I started asking myself was: could I use the same FF profile from the laptop & the main machine? Say by saving it in the cloud?

Thanks for any hint or suggestion!
creator: giampaolo44

title: Cannot access/recover 7,500 tabs from old profile
content:
Hi,

This is my first time posting here. I had written detailed information, then scrolled down to the troubleshooting information section and made the mistake of clicking: try these manual steps.

That link should have opened in a new tab! I lost everything I wrote here, pressing back didn't preserve the text I had entered here.

I have 7,500 tabs in an old profile on my laptop. After many crashes and using Refresh, I can't fix it as I did before.

Please fix this Ask Your Question page so it doesn't lose what I've written here so easily. Show a warning, and open links in new tabs.

And Firefox should have an option to automatically bookmark open tabs so that if anyone experiences this crash/corruption I've had, all their open tabs are safely backed up in bookmarks and Firefox sync.

Also the Submit Feedback button in Firefox's help menu is still going to a page showing: Please check back soon. Feels like it's been a month since I was last able to send feedback. Please fix this!

Thanks!
creator: Aku-Solus
